idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract: United States Major Roads is a polyline theme representing interstates, U.S. and state highways, major streets, and other major thoroughfares within the United States. Attribute information includes the name, FCC code and type of road. This dataset is a part of the 2010 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States Major Roads provides an invaluable reference and cartographic layer that make it easy to identify areas in other data sets. U.S. Major Roads overlays accurately on streets and other boundary data.
descript.supplinf:
Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:50,000.
This dataset comes with an ESRI layer file symbolizing the features.

citeinfo.title: United States Major Roads, 2010
citeinfo.origin: Economic and Social Research Institute (Reston, Va.)

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent the interstates, freeways, highways, major streets and roads, primary, secondary, and local roads, access ramps, ferry crossings, and other major thoroughfares within the United States.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The full name or route number of the road.
The name of the state in which the road is located.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The Functional Road Class of the road. It is designed to categorize types of transportation elements based on their functional importance within the transportation network.

edom.edomvd: The road class is Interstate, Freeway, or Other Major Road.
The road class is Major Road Less Important than an Interstate.
The road class is Other Major Road.
The road class is Secondary Road.
The road class is Local Connecting Road.
The road class is Local Road of High Importance.

attr.attrdef: The Functional Road Class description of the road.

edom.edomv: Freeway or Other Major Road, Major Road Less Important than a Freeway, Other Major Road, Secondary Road, Local Connecting Road, Important Local Road
edom.edomvd: The Functional Road Class descriptions of the road.

attr.attrdef: The shield type of the road based on its route number signpost.

edom.edomvd: The shield type of the road is Interstate Highway.
The shield type of the road is U.S. Highway.
The shield type of the road is State Highway and Route.
The shield type of the road is Secondary State Highway and Route.
The shield type of the road is Other Major Road.
The road does not have a shield type.

attr.attrdef: The primary route number of the road.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.

srcinfo.srccitea: Tele Atlas MultiNet North America v. 2010.03

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the U.S. major road features from Tele Atlas MultiNet North America v. 2010.03. Deleted unnecessary fields. Added field FRC_DESC and copied its values from MultiNet FRC descriptions. Added field SHIELD and calculated its values based on MultiNet RTETYP equivalents. Renamed field SHIELDNUM to HWY_NUM. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).
